content: "http://www.williamkwolfrum.com/2009/05/27/statement-from-william-k-wolfrum-we-white-men-are-now-an-infinitesimally-oppressed-slightly-less-powerful-majority/" quote: “My friends, for many years, I have lived a life of divine privilege. By birthright, I was special - white as all get out and as male as could be. Basically, I hit the genetic lottery, and grew to be secure in the fact that all rights available to a human belonged to me. But those days have come to and end, and with them, a tiny percentage of my hopes and dreams. You see, in just over six months, the United States has seen a black man be elected President of the United States, and a Latin woman be nominated for Supreme Court. My friends, these jobs were once the sole property of men like me. White men. White men who didn’t care about non-white men, and didn’t have to because we’re white. But those times are changing. And I am frightened. Now, sure, I understand there are white men out there that will help white men like myself bridge the infinitesimally small new gap. I also understand that white men still make up 90 percent or more of Congress, and roughly 100 percent of the mainstream media. But these privileges are no longer purely a given, and in fact have the unseemly feel of large-partism just thrown our way by the minorly less impotent minority class. Because, you see, not that long ago, when a Supreme Court seat opened up, I had the warm comfort of knowing that I - with no law experience whatsoever - had a much better chance at becoming a Supreme Court Justice than a woman with a Puerto Rican heritage. A woman who would have never even have been given the opportunity to gain law experience not so long ago. But now, I feel the same oppression as the blacks that were enslaved in the U.S., and the Native Americans who were slaughtered. I am now part of an oppressed, negligibly less powerful majority. So what happens to me now? This year the Supreme Court is off limits to a white, non-law-practicing male like myself. And the Presidency is now firmly in the hands of someone who lacks the comforting whiteness that I and my fellow white men have come to accept as the norm. As someone who once had limitless opportunities, I now find the ease of which I could stumble into those opportunities limited ever-so slightly. But I believe that we White men can come back and reclaim the absolute and complete power we once held. We must begin our own civil rights struggle. We must take to the streets. It is time for a white male movement. I believe it is time for white men to get together and form an organization that fights for our needs. In keeping with this new “Enlarge the Gap” movement, we should dress uniformly, perhaps in all white to further enhance our whiteness. Let me tell you, organization is key. And while the triflingly more powerful minorities of this nation may scoff at a large, well-organized group of white men marching the streets dressed in white with torches, for we white males it will be the type of thing that empowers us. Because the ruling, pampered minorities do not understand what an angry group of vaguely oppressed white men can accomplish. They have no historical perspective, at least as far as I learned at the private school I attended. They see us only as extremely powerful, but not God-like any longer. This tiny, almost unnoticeable gap between deity and hyper-powerful is a gap we must close. We must fight. Today, a white male child will be born into an oppressive society where the color of his skin will only be a great advantage, not an incomprehensibly powerful advantage. That child will see that there is now extra competition out there between himself and his dreams. That child will be born into a society that - while understanding his cultural values and belief systems - will no longer automatically fearfully submit to them. That child will be destined for a life of dreams and promises that will only very likely be fulfilled. The guarantee is now gone, and we must get it back. My white male friends, we shall overcome. We are a theoretically oppressed majority, but our voices can be heard. White men, spit the imperceptibly less silver spoon from your mouths and yell to the skies “The White Man will rise again! Power to the white male.” Thank you, and I have retained counsel, several bodyguards, a maid, hairstylist and personal valet on this matter.” Satirical humor from William K. Wolfrum. But remember, in all humor there is an element of truth - and there will be those who will read his comments and say "He's right" rather than say "That's funny".

content: Morons like this Wolfrum seem to forget, or perhaps be blissfully ignorant of, the fact that most ethnic groups have suffered periods of discrimination. The Irish were once considered sub-human and the term "No Irish Need Apply" was commonplace. Italians were accorded similar treatment as were many other groups. All this sort of race baiting "humor" manages to accomplish is to keep things agitated with artificially inflamed passions.

content: Duster...! Growing up in DC my Dad was in the Navy...our neighborhood was 85% black (as is the City of DC)...some Irish, some Italian, some Chinese..some Jewish but mostly a black community. Generally, we all got along fine... but those in charge politically and financially were the black residents (families there for over a 100 years)...they had no concerns about discrimination. However, the other races had to make sure they stroked the right folks the right way if we were to keep good relations. That is civilization on both ends. Most of the black people were down to earth good folks, some were problems but so were some of the other non-black members of the community. DC was and is a unique city in the US. My best friends was a black guy I ran track with... My thought is that politics has created a false status among American citizens that creates friction just to be politically correct. No society is free of faux discrimination for the sake of creating a power base or real discrimination based on racial hatred. In the US most racial discrimination is used to achieve social leverage and used for advancement beyond expectations.

content: It is interesting to me that when a white male, such as myself, ceases to recieve special favorable treatment in housing/employment/military and civilian job promotions/admission into college/duty assignments while in the military (i.e. KP, guard duty, etc. **)/etc., some white males feel compelled to whine, "I'm being discriminated against because I'm a white male!" All my 57 years of life I know I have received special favorable treatment because I was born a white male. But somehow I just can't feel "discriminated against" when I get treated the same as a black male, a Hispanic male, an Asian male or a woman of any ethnic/racial/national background. Guess my white father and my white mother trained me incorrectly... ** I was in the room when a white E-1 tried to use, as a defense for disobeying a direct order and dereliction of duty, the argument that he was being "discriminated against as a white man" because he was put on KP duty and he was justified in not showing up to scrub pots and pans when his name came up on the KP duty roster. He actually was stupid enough to tell the Battalion commander that all duty rosters for KP and guard duty should be filled with the non-whites in the Battalion first, since white people were "too good" to pull those duties.

title: “We White Men are now an oppressed majority”

content: "http://www.williamkwolfrum.com/2009/05/27/statement-from-william-k-wolfrum-we-white-men-are-now-an-infinitesimally-oppressed-slightly-less-powerful-majority/" quote: “My friends, for many years, I have lived a life of divine privilege. By birthright, I was special - white as all get out and as male as could be. Basically, I hit the genetic lottery, and grew to be secure in the fact that all rights available to a human belonged to me. But those days have come to and end, and with them, a tiny percentage of my hopes and dreams. You see, in just over six months, the United States has seen a black man be elected President of the United States, and a Latin woman be nominated for Supreme Court. My friends, these jobs were once the sole property of men like me. White men. White men who didn’t care about non-white men, and didn’t have to because we’re white. But those times are changing. And I am frightened. Now, sure, I understand there are white men out there that will help white men like myself bridge the infinitesimally small new gap. I also understand that white men still make up 90 percent or more of Congress, and roughly 100 percent of the mainstream media. But these privileges are no longer purely a given, and in fact have the unseemly feel of large-partism just thrown our way by the minorly less impotent minority class. Because, you see, not that long ago, when a Supreme Court seat opened up, I had the warm comfort of knowing that I - with no law experience whatsoever - had a much better chance at becoming a Supreme Court Justice than a woman with a Puerto Rican heritage. A woman who would have never even have been given the opportunity to gain law experience not so long ago. But now, I feel the same oppression as the blacks that were enslaved in the U.S., and the Native Americans who were slaughtered. I am now part of an oppressed, negligibly less powerful majority. So what happens to me now? This year the Supreme Court is off limits to a white, non-law-practicing male like myself. And the Presidency is now firmly in the hands of someone who lacks the comforting whiteness that I and my fellow white men have come to accept as the norm. As someone who once had limitless opportunities, I now find the ease of which I could stumble into those opportunities limited ever-so slightly. But I believe that we White men can come back and reclaim the absolute and complete power we once held. We must begin our own civil rights struggle. We must take to the streets. It is time for a white male movement. I believe it is time for white men to get together and form an organization that fights for our needs. In keeping with this new “Enlarge the Gap” movement, we should dress uniformly, perhaps in all white to further enhance our whiteness. Let me tell you, organization is key. And while the triflingly more powerful minorities of this nation may scoff at a large, well-organized group of white men marching the streets dressed in white with torches, for we white males it will be the type of thing that empowers us. Because the ruling, pampered minorities do not understand what an angry group of vaguely oppressed white men can accomplish. They have no historical perspective, at least as far as I learned at the private school I attended. They see us only as extremely powerful, but not God-like any longer. This tiny, almost unnoticeable gap between deity and hyper-powerful is a gap we must close. We must fight. Today, a white male child will be born into an oppressive society where the color of his skin will only be a great advantage, not an incomprehensibly powerful advantage. That child will see that there is now extra competition out there between himself and his dreams. That child will be born into a society that - while understanding his cultural values and belief systems - will no longer automatically fearfully submit to them. That child will be destined for a life of dreams and promises that will only very likely be fulfilled. The guarantee is now gone, and we must get it back. My white male friends, we shall overcome. We are a theoretically oppressed majority, but our voices can be heard. White men, spit the imperceptibly less silver spoon from your mouths and yell to the skies “The White Man will rise again! Power to the white male.” Thank you, and I have retained counsel, several bodyguards, a maid, hairstylist and personal valet on this matter.” Satirical humor from William K. Wolfrum. But remember, in all humor there is an element of truth - and there will be those who will read his comments and say "He's right" rather than say "That's funny".

content: Duster...! Growing up in DC my Dad was in the Navy...our neighborhood was 85% black (as is the City of DC)...some Irish, some Italian, some Chinese..some Jewish but mostly a black community. Generally, we all got along fine... but those in charge politically and financially were the black residents (families there for over a 100 years)...they had no concerns about discrimination. However, the other races had to make sure they stroked the right folks the right way if we were to keep good relations. That is civilization on both ends. Most of the black people were down to earth good folks, some were problems but so were some of the other non-black members of the community. DC was and is a unique city in the US. My best friends was a black guy I ran track with... My thought is that politics has created a false status among American citizens that creates friction just to be politically correct. No society is free of faux discrimination for the sake of creating a power base or real discrimination based on racial hatred. In the US most racial discrimination is used to achieve social leverage and used for advancement beyond expectations.

content: It is interesting to me that when a white male, such as myself, ceases to recieve special favorable treatment in housing/employment/military and civilian job promotions/admission into college/duty assignments while in the military (i.e. KP, guard duty, etc. **)/etc., some white males feel compelled to whine, "I'm being discriminated against because I'm a white male!" All my 57 years of life I know I have received special favorable treatment because I was born a white male. But somehow I just can't feel "discriminated against" when I get treated the same as a black male, a Hispanic male, an Asian male or a woman of any ethnic/racial/national background. Guess my white father and my white mother trained me incorrectly... ** I was in the room when a white E-1 tried to use, as a defense for disobeying a direct order and dereliction of duty, the argument that he was being "discriminated against as a white man" because he was put on KP duty and he was justified in not showing up to scrub pots and pans when his name came up on the KP duty roster. He actually was stupid enough to tell the Battalion commander that all duty rosters for KP and guard duty should be filled with the non-whites in the Battalion first, since white people were "too good" to pull those duties.

content: quote: but the OP altered the intent with the highlighting of specific portions of the piece. I don't see how highlighting something alters intent. It's not like something was omitted. Just highlighted. If you highlighted portions of A Modest Proposal would that somehow "alter Swifts intent"? Of course it wouldn't. as for the accusations of race baiting....well...I don't see how the article or the OP used "racially derisive language, actions or other forms of communication, to anger, intimidate or incite a person or groups of people, or to make those persons behave in ways that are inimical to their personal or group interests."
